Long Call.tip: Simple bullish bet with limited risk, unlimited profit.
Long Call.description:
A bullish strategy buying one call option at-the-money (ATM).
- Market outlook: Expecting strong upside.
- Profit: Unlimited if price rises.
- Risk: Limited to premium paid.
- Breakeven: Strike + premium.
- Volatility: Benefits from higher volatility.
- Greeks: Long Delta, Long Gamma, Long Vega, Short Theta.

Bull Call Spread.tip: Moderate bullish move, limited risk and reward.
Bull Call Spread.description:
A limited-risk bullish strategy using a long call and short higher-strike call.
- Market outlook: Moderately bullish.
- Profit: Limited to difference between strikes minus net premium.
- Risk: Limited to net premium paid.
- Breakeven: Lower strike + net premium.
- Volatility: Neutral to rising volatility.
- Greeks: Limited Delta, Long Gamma, Limited Vega, Short Theta.

Bull Put Spread.tip: Moderately bullish, limited risk and reward.
Bull Put Spread.description:
A credit spread strategy where the trader sells a put option and buys a lower-strike put option.
- Market outlook: Moderately bullish (expect price to stay above short put strike).
- Profit: Limited to net premium received.
- Risk: Limited to strike difference minus premium.
- Breakeven: Short put strike - net premium.
- Volatility: Benefits from falling volatility.
- Greeks: Long Delta (net bullish), Short Vega, Short Gamma, Positive Theta.

Covered Call.tip: Generate income on long stock/futures with capped upside.
Covered Call.description:
A moderately bullish income strategy combining long futures with short call.
- Market outlook: Sideways to mildly bullish.
- Profit: Limited (capped at short call strike).
- Risk: Large downside risk from underlying.
- Breakeven: Spot - premium received.
- Volatility: Works best in low volatility.
- Greeks: Long Delta (from future), Short Vega, Short Gamma, Positive Theta.

Long Future.description: A simple bullish strategy using a futures contract, with no defined risk or profit limits.

Long Put.tip: Simple bearish bet with limited risk.
Long Put.description:
A bearish strategy buying one put option at-the-money (ATM).
- Market outlook: Strong downside expected.
- Profit: Significant if price falls, limited to strike - premium.
- Risk: Limited to premium paid.
- Breakeven: Strike - premium.
- Volatility: Benefits from higher volatility.
- Greeks: Short Delta, Long Gamma, Long Vega, Short Theta.

Short Call.tip: Bearish to neutral income strategy, unlimited risk.
Short Call.description:
A strategy where the trader sells one call option, typically at or slightly out-of-the-money.
- Market outlook: Neutral to bearish (expecting price to stay below strike).
- Profit: Limited to the premium received.
- Risk: Unlimited if price rises sharply above the strike.
- Breakeven: Strike + premium received.
- Volatility: Benefits from falling volatility.
- Greeks: Short Delta, Short Gamma, Short Vega, Positive Theta.

Short Put.tip: Bullish income strategy, high risk if market falls.
Short Put.description:
A strategy where the trader sells one put option, typically at or slightly out-of-the-money.
- Market outlook: Neutral to bullish (expecting price to stay above strike).
- Profit: Limited to the premium received.
- Risk: Large downside risk if price falls significantly.
- Breakeven: Strike - premium received.
- Volatility: Benefits from falling volatility.
- Greeks: Long Delta, Short Gamma, Short Vega, Positive Theta.

Bear Put Spread.tip: Moderate bearish move with defined risk/reward.
Bear Put Spread.description:
A limited-risk bearish strategy using a long put and short lower-strike put.
- Market outlook: Moderately bearish.
- Profit: Limited to strike difference - net premium.
- Risk: Limited to net premium paid.
- Breakeven: Higher strike - net premium.
- Volatility: Neutral to rising volatility.
- Greeks: Limited Delta, Long Gamma, Limited Vega, Short Theta.

Bear Call Spread.tip: Moderately bearish, limited risk and reward.
Bear Call Spread.description:
A credit spread strategy where the trader sells a call and buys a higher-strike call.
- Market outlook: Moderately bearish (expect price to stay below short call strike).
- Profit: Limited to net premium received.
- Risk: Limited to strike difference minus premium.
- Breakeven: Short call strike + net premium.
- Volatility: Benefits from falling volatility.
- Greeks: Short Delta (net bearish), Short Vega, Short Gamma, Positive Theta.

Protective Put.tip: Insurance for a long position, limits downside.
Protective Put.description:
A hedging strategy: long futures plus long put for downside protection.
- Market outlook: Bullish but want protection.
- Profit: Unlimited upside, downside limited by put.
- Risk: Premium paid for put.
- Breakeven: Future entry + premium.
- Volatility: Better in higher volatility if insurance is needed.
- Greeks: Long Delta (from future), Long Vega, Long Gamma, Short Theta.

Short Future.description: A simple bearish strategy using a futures contract, with no defined risk or profit limits.

Strangle.tip: Cheaper volatility play, needs larger move than straddle.
Strangle.description:
A cheaper volatility strategy: buy OTM call and put.
- Market outlook: Expecting very large moves.
- Profit: Unlimited if price moves strongly.
- Risk: Limited to total premiums (cheaper than straddle).
- Breakevens: Upper strike + premium, Lower strike - premium.
- Volatility: Profits from high volatility.
- Greeks: Neutral Delta, Long Vega, Long Gamma, Short Theta.

Straddle.tip: Bet on big moves in either direction.
Straddle.description:
A volatility strategy buying both ATM call and put.
- Market outlook: Expecting large move, unsure direction.
- Profit: Unlimited if market moves strongly either way.
- Risk: Limited to total premium paid.
- Breakevens: Strike Â± premiums.
- Volatility: Profits from high volatility.
- Greeks: Neutral Delta, Long Vega, Long Gamma, Short Theta.

Iron Condor.tip: Neutral strategy, profits from low volatility and time decay.
Iron Condor.description:
A four-leg options strategy combining a bull put spread and a bear call spread.
- Market outlook: Neutral, expecting price to stay within a range.
- Profit: Limited to total net premium received.
- Risk: Limited to difference between strikes minus premium.
- Breakevens: Lower short put strike - premium, Upper short call strike + premium.
- Volatility: Best in low volatility markets.
- Greeks: Near Delta neutral, Short Vega, Short Gamma, Positive Theta.

Iron Butterfly.tip: Neutral strategy, high credit, needs price to stay near middle strike.
Iron Butterfly.description:
A four-leg options strategy combining a short straddle with protective wings.
- Market outlook: Neutral, expecting little movement.
- Profit: Limited to net premium received (high credit).
- Risk: Limited to wing spread minus premium.
- Breakevens: Middle strike Â± (wing width - net credit).
- Volatility: Best in low volatility markets.
- Greeks: Near Delta neutral, Short Vega, Short Gamma, Positive Theta.

Long Butterfly (Call).tip: Neutral strategy with low cost, best if price stays near middle strike.
Long Butterfly (Call).description:
A debit spread using calls at three different strikes: buy 1 lower call, sell 2 middle calls, buy 1 higher call.
- Market outlook: Neutral, expecting little movement around middle strike.
- Profit: Limited, occurs if price finishes at middle strike.
- Risk: Limited to net debit paid.
- Breakevens: Lower strike + debit, Upper strike - debit.
- Volatility: Profits from low volatility.
- Greeks: Near Delta neutral, Short Vega, Long Gamma around middle strike, Negative Theta.

Long Butterfly (Put).tip: Neutral strategy, built with puts, best if price stays near middle strike.
Long Butterfly (Put).description:
A debit spread using puts at three different strikes: buy 1 higher put, sell 2 middle puts, buy 1 lower put.
- Market outlook: Neutral, expecting little movement around middle strike.
- Profit: Limited, occurs if price finishes at middle strike.
- Risk: Limited to net debit paid.
- Breakevens: Upper strike - debit, Lower strike + debit.
- Volatility: Profits from low volatility.
- Greeks: Near Delta neutral, Short Vega, Long Gamma around middle strike, Negative Theta.

Synthetic Long Stock.description: Used to replicate the profit/loss profile of owning a stock using options. Based on the concept of put-call parity.

Collar.description:
A hedging strategy using long future, long put, and short call.
- Market outlook: Hold position but limit downside and upside.
- Profit: Capped upside (short call).
- Risk: Limited downside (long put).
- Breakeven: Future entry Â± premiums.
- Volatility: Works well in uncertain markets.
- Greeks: Long Delta (from future), Mix of Vega depending on strikes, Neutral to Short Theta.

Calendar Spread.description:
A time-based strategy using options of different expiries.
- Market outlook: Neutral short term, move expected later.
- Profit: From time decay of short option.
- Risk: Limited to net premium.
- Breakeven: Depends on strikes and premiums.
- Volatility: Benefits from rising implied volatility in longer-term option.
- Greeks: Short Theta (short leg), Long Vega (long leg).

Diagonal Spread (Call) multi-expiry.description: Similar to a Calendar Spread but uses different strike prices, offering more flexibility.

Double Diagonal multi-expiry.description: A complex, non-directional strategy used to profit from time decay. It is essentially an Iron Condor using diagonal spreads.

Synthetic Covered Call.description: Replicates a covered call using futures. A long futures position is hedged with a short call to generate income.

Synthetic Protective Put.description: Replicates a protective put. A long futures position is hedged with a long put to limit downside risk.

Synthetic Long with Futures.tip: Use options to replicate or enhance a long future position.
Synthetic Long with Futures.description:
Combine a long call and short put with a long future to create leveraged bullish exposure or hedge short positions.
- Market outlook: Very bullish.
- Profit: Unlimited upside.
- Risk: Large downside risk.
- Volatility: Sensitive to volatility shifts.
- Greeks: Similar to futures but with Vega exposure.

Synthetic Short with Futures.tip: Replicate or boost a short futures position using options.
Synthetic Short with Futures.description:
Combine a short call and long put (same strike & expiry) with a short future. This creates leveraged bearish exposure or can hedge long exposure.
- Market outlook: Strongly bearish.
- Profit: Significant if price falls.
- Risk: Unlimited upside risk.
- Breakeven: Strike Â± option premiums.
- Volatility: Benefits if implied volatility falls when holding synthetic exposure.
- Greeks: Short Delta, Long Gamma, Short Vega, Short Theta.

Futures Calendar Spread.tip: Neutral to directional play using different futures expiries.
Futures Calendar Spread.description:
A spread strategy involving long and short futures in different expiries (same underlying).
- Market outlook: Typically used to trade expectations of price changes across time, not outright direction.
- Profit: Limited to difference in price movement between the two contracts.
- Risk: Substantial if spread widens unexpectedly.
- Breakeven: Depends on relative pricing of contracts.
- Volatility: Sensitive to changes in term structure (contango/backwardation).
- Greeks: No options Greeks, but carries calendar spread risk.

Delta-Hedged Strangle.tip: Cheaper volatility trade with futures hedge.
Delta-Hedged Strangle.description:
Buy an out-of-the-money call and put (strangle) and hedge Delta with futures. This provides volatility exposure with lower upfront cost than a straddle.
- Market outlook: Expecting very large moves but no directional bias.
- Profit: Large gains if volatility explodes.
- Risk: Limited to total premiums and hedge cost.
- Breakevens: Upper strike + premiums, Lower strike - premiums (adjusted with hedge).
- Volatility: Profits from very high realized volatility.
- Greeks: Delta neutral, Long Vega, Long Gamma, Short Theta.

Delta-Hedged Straddle.description:
Buy a straddle (long call + long put) and short futures in proportion to Delta to remain neutral.
- Market outlook: Expecting big volatility but no directional bias.
- Profit: Gains if realized volatility exceeds implied volatility.
- Risk: Time decay (Theta) and Vega exposure.
- Greeks: Delta neutral, Long Vega, Long Gamma, Short Theta.
